title.narrative: 3. COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT

description.narrative: by 2022, Local counsellors, village development committees, communities and women's and youth organizations have capacity to participate in social planning and budgeting, and citizen monitoring., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Adolescent Empowerment, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: by 2022, Children (girls/boys) and women, especially the most disadvantaged, have better access to social protection programmes and the state budget allocation to exercise their rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: by 2022, Local counsellors, village development committees, communities and women?s and youth organizations have capacity toparticipate in social planning and budgeting, and citizen monitoring.

description.narrative: To date, 13 municipalities out of the 22 targeted ones have a Municipal Development Plan. Technical support to the development of the MDPs was ensured through an innovative, participatory planning process, using HRBA and RBM approaches.With UNICEF’s support, local governance was improved in 183 municipalities with the implementation of social accountability and citizen control mechanisms, resulting in improved synergy between local authorities and the community in the dialogue around local development planning and monitoring. The Parliament, through its relevant Commission, recognized the value added of such mechanism for an effective inclusive local development. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:29/01/2022
